body.p: Antigens that are present inside body cells are called antigens. Such foreign antigens may be viral proteins produced after a virus infects the cell, toxins produced from intracellular bacteria, or abnormal proteins synthesized by a cancerous cell. When a peptide fragment comes from a self-protein, T cells ignore the /epitope complex. However, if the peptide fragment comes from a foreign protein, T cells recognize the MHC-I/epitope complex and an immune response occurs.
